elements.title: News(Top News : The government says South Korean inspectors set to visit Japan's Fukushima nuclear power plant will observe the entire process of the wastewater release and review the overall safety of the discharge.) - 2023.05.12 PM5

News(Top News : The government decides to lower the COVID-19 crisis level and lift the mandatory seven-day quarantine for infected patients in a major step towards ending the virus-induced health emergency.) - 2023.05.11 PM5
News(Top News : People Power Party lawmaker Tae Young-ho steps down from the party's Supreme Council ahead of expected disciplinary measures.) - 2023.05.10 PM5
News(Top News : Prosecutors place a key suspect in a massive stock price manipulation scandal under a 48-hour detention.) - 2023.05.09 PM5
News(Top News : Resuming their shuttle diplomacy, South Korea and Japan agree to closer cooperation amid North Korean threats in a summit in Seoul.) - 2023.05.08 PM5
News(Top News : The World Health Organization ends its global health emergency designation for COVID-19) - 2023.05.06 PM5
News(Top News : The U.S. Federal Reserve raises its key interest rate by another quarter of a percentage point.) - 2023.05.04 PM5
News(Top News : President Yoon Suk Yeol says China's refusal to enforce UN sanctions on North Korea leaves Seoul no choice but to rely on U.S. extended deterrence.) - 2023.05.03 PM5
News(Top News : Ex-Democratic Party chief Song Young-gil accuses the prosecution of conducting a politically motivated investigation after being snubbed.) - 2023.05.02 PM5
